info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 07 at 3:21PM PST until December 08 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 PM PST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT... -Snow expected with accumulations of 5 to 9 inches and winds gusting as high as 40 mph that could cause blowing snow. -For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible, with accumulations of 5 to 17 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades. Both the advisory and watch include Mt. Ashland and the road leading up there. The watch also includes Siskiyou summit & I-5, Howard Prairie, and portions of highways 140 and 66. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM to 10 PM PST Thursday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday afternoon through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
